t: Job 19
Job Replies: My Redeemer Lives
Then*p Job answered and said:
“How*pn long will you torment me and*ld break me in pieces with words?
These*ln ten times you have cast reproach upon me; are*ld you not ashamed to wrong me?
And*ln even if it be true that I have erred, my*ld error remains with myself.
If*ln indeed you magnify yourselves against me and*ld make my disgrace an argument against me,
know*ln then that God has put me in the wrong and*ld closed his net about me.
Behold,*ln I cry out, ‘Violence!’ but I am not answered; I*ld call for help, but there is no justice.
He*ln has walled up my way, so that I cannot pass, and*ld he has set darkness upon my paths.
He*ln has stripped from me my glory and*ld taken the crown from my head.
He*ln breaks me down on every side, and I am gone, and*ld my hope has he pulled up like a tree.
He*ln has kindled his wrath against me and*ld counts me as his adversary.
His*ln troops come on together; they*ld have cast up their siege ramp against me and*ld encamp around my tent.
“He*pn has put my brothers far from me, and*ld those who knew me are wholly estranged from me.
My*ln relatives have failed me, my*ld close friends have forgotten me.
The*ln guests in my house and my maidservants count me as a stranger; I*ld have become a foreigner in their eyes.
I*ln call to my servant, but he gives me no answer; I*ld must plead with him with my mouth for mercy.
My*ln breath is strange to my wife, and*ld I am a stench to the children of my own mother.
Even*ln young children despise me; when*ld I rise they talk against me.
All*ln my intimate friends abhor me, and*ld those whom I loved have turned against me.
My*ln bones stick to my skin and to my flesh, and*ld I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.
Have*ln mercy on me, have mercy on me, O you my friends, for*ld the hand of God has touched me!
Why*ln do you, like God, pursue me? Why*ld are you not satisfied with my flesh?
“Oh*pn that my words were written! Oh*ld that they were inscribed in a book!
Oh*ln that with an iron pen and lead they*ld were engraved in the rock forever!
For*ln I know that my Redeemer lives, and*ld at the last he will stand upon the earth.
And*ln after my skin has been thus destroyed, yet*ld in my flesh I shall see God,
whom*ln I shall see for myself, and*ld my eyes shall behold, and not another. My*ld heart faints within me!
If*ln you say, ‘How we will pursue him!’ and,*ld ‘The root of the matter is found in him,’
be*ln afraid of the sword, for*ld wrath brings the punishment of the sword, that*ld you may know there is a judgment.”
